property.description:
The SolutionPack combines MDS/Nexus reporting into a single pane of glass.

The Cisco MDS 9000 Series Multilayer SAN Switches can help lower the total cost of ownership of the most demanding storage environments. By combining a robust and flexible hardware architecture with multiple layers of network and storage-management intelligence, the Cisco MDS 9000 Series helps you build highly available, scalable storage networks with advanced security and unified management.

Modular Cisco Nexus 5000 & 7000 Series Switches deliver a comprehensive NX-OS feature set, with high-density 10, 40, and 100 Gigabit Ethernet for the data center and campus core network.

property.displayedProperties: partsn[Port WWN] vsanid[Member of VSAN id] partnb[Part Number] serialnb[Serial Number] ifacemac status[Port Status] fcstatus[Status Description] ifalias[Interface Description] fcoper[FC Type]

property.name: Port WWN of the FC device

property.description: This report will show only if you have configured the SSH collector for APG (part of the ReportPack).
This report will show only if you have configured the SSH collector for APG (part of the ReportPack).

A virtual storage area network (VSAN) is a collection of ports from a set of connected Fibre Channel switches, that form a virtual fabric. Ports within a single switch can be partitioned into multiple VSANs, despite sharing hardware resources. Conversely, multiple switches can join a number of ports to form a single VSAN.

The use of VSANs allows traffic to be isolated within specific portions of the network. If a problem occurs in one VSAN, that problem can be handled with a minimum of disruption to the rest of the network. VSANs can also be configured separately and independently.

property.name: Port WWN of the FC device

property.description: Occupied ports are determined by the Operational Status values (if port is Oper Up)

A virtual storage area network (VSAN) is a collection of ports from a set of connected Fibre Channel switches, that form a virtual fabric. Ports within a single switch can be partitioned into multiple VSANs, despite sharing hardware resources. Conversely, multiple switches can join a number of ports to form a single VSAN.

The use of VSANs allows traffic to be isolated within specific portions of the network. If a problem occurs in one VSAN, that problem can be handled with a minimum of disruption to the rest of the network. VSANs can also be configured separately and independently.

property.name: Port WWN of the FC device

property.description: The name server functionality maintains a database containing the attributes for all hosts and storage devices in each VSAN. Name servers allow a database entry to be modified by a device that originally registered the information.

This report will show only if you have configured the SSH collector for APG (part of the ReportPack).

If "diff" columns are empty, it's most likely that the port is not connected to an APG's known port. I.e. Port is not connected to another switch monitored by APG.
Report will be empty if all ports don't have errors
